official-title.#text:
To amend section 1862 of the Social Security Act with
		  respect to the application of Medicare secondary payer rules to workers’
		  compensation settlement agreements and Medicare set-asides under such
		  agreements.

header.#text:

text.#text:
In the case of a
				compromise settlement agreement, a claimant or workers’ compensation payer who
				is party to the agreement may elect to calculate the Medicare set-aside amount
				of the agreement by applying a percentage reduction to the Medicare set-aside
				amount for the total settlement amount that could have been payable under the
				applicable workers’ compensation law or similar plan involved had the denied or
				contested portion of the claim not been subject to a compromise agreement. The
				percentage reduction shall be equal to the denied or contested percentage of
				such total settlement. Such election may be made by a party to the agreement
				only with the written consent of the other party to the agreement.

If the claimant or workers’ compensation
				payer elects to calculate the Medicare set-aside amount under this clause, the
				Medicare set-aside shall be deemed a qualified Medicare set-aside.
